instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.PP3V3_SUS: What is PP3V3_SUS? The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .
definitions.PP3V3_S4: What is PP3V3_S4? The "PP3V3_S4" power rail in a MacBook is used to supply 3.3 volts to certain components when the system is in the S4 power state, also known as "suspend to disk" or "hibernate." This rail is active when the MacBook is not fully off but not in an awake state, allowing for faster startup times compared to a full boot sequence. The S4 power state means Suspend to Disk: This is a low-power state where the system context is saved to disk, allowing the system to be powered down almost entirely. Upon waking, the system can restore its state from the disk, effectively resuming where it left off..
definitions.PP5V_S4RS3: What is PP5V_S4RS3? PP5V_S4RS3 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS: What is PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS? This power rail is PPBUS_G3H after going through a current sense resistor that sits between PPBUS_G3H & the input of PPBUS_G3H to circuitry that provides power for the CPU..
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL: What is PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL? This is the voltage coming directly from the charger after going through a transistor. .
definitions.P5VS4RS3_EN: What is P5VS4RS3_EN? PP5VS4RS3_EN is a signal that enables the PP5V_S4RS3 power rail. When you see _EN in front of a signal name, it means that it is enabling whatever comes before the _EN when the signal is high..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MacBook Air No power.
threads.message:
Hi, all.
Got a 2015 MBA not powering on. No liquid damage, no crusty corrosion, nothing visually bad on the board.

Tested so far:

Green / orange light on magSafe

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 8.5
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS</SIGNAL> = 8.5
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL</SIGNAL> = 14.9

<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> = 14.9

<SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> = 3.3v


<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> = 5v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL> = 0v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> = 0V


<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> = 3.3v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4</SIGNAL> = 0v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL> = 3.3v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S3</SIGNAL> = 0v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> = 0v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4SW_SNS</SIGNAL> = 0v

<SIGNAL>P5VS4RS3_EN</SIGNAL> = 0v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MacBook Air No power.
threads.message:
Update..

Well, I'll claim the glory for "fixing" this one. Must have been my voodoo dance :)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MacBook Air No power.
threads.message: Im in the same boat with same readings.. how did you go about this one?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MacBook Air No power.
threads.message: Hooked it up to the bench PSU, forced S0, the fan spun on max for a bit. Undid all the solder blobs, removed PSU, removed MagSafe, replugged MagSafe and left it pluged in and did something else.... Forgot it was even there until the place was quite enough to hear the fan on full rev. In short. No idea, pure voodoo.
